skill.name: gitlab-ci-patterns
skill.description: Build GitLab CI/CD pipelines with multi-stage workflows, caching, and distributed runners for scalable automation. Use when implementing GitLab CI/CD, optimizing pipeline performance, or setting up automated testing and deployment.
skill.summary: Build GitLab CI/CD pipelines with multi-stage workflows, caching, and distributed runners for scalab...

security_audit.summary: No malicious code or data theft patterns detected. Content is static documentation with YAML examples and no executable logic.

content.value_statement: Many teams struggle to design reliable GitLab CI workflows. This skill provides proven pipeline patterns for builds, tests, deployments, and scanning.
actual_capabilities: Provide a basic multi stage GitLab CI pipeline example
Show Docker build and push job patterns with registry login
Describe multi environment deployment with Kubernetes jobs
Include Terraform validate, plan, and apply pipeline stages
Include security scanning jobs using GitLab templates and Trivy
Show caching strategies and child pipeline generation examples
limitations: Does not execute or validate pipelines in a live GitLab project
Does not include actual files for referenced assets and templates
Does not cover secrets management beyond CI variable mention
Examples may need adaptation for project specific tooling

use_cases.title: Standardize CI patterns
use_cases.description: Create a consistent GitLab CI template for multiple repositories.

use_cases.title: Add deployment stages
use_cases.description: Extend existing pipelines with Kubernetes deploy jobs.

use_cases.title: Improve pipeline speed
use_cases.description: Apply caching and artifacts patterns to reduce build time.

prompt_templates.title: Starter pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a simple GitLab CI pipeline with build, test, and deploy stages for a Node.js app.

prompt_templates.title: Docker build push
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a GitLab CI job to build and push Docker images on main and tags.

prompt_templates.title: Terraform workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate validate, plan, and apply stages for Terraform with manual apply.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced deploy
prompt_templates.prompt: Design staging and production deploy jobs using kubectl with a shared template.

output_examples.input: Show a GitLab CI pipeline for build, test, deploy with caching
output: Stages include build, test, and deploy with clear ordering
Build job uses node:20 and caches node_modules
Test job runs lint and tests with coverage reporting
Deploy job runs kubectl apply and waits for rollout
Artifacts keep build outputs for one hour

best_practices: Use specific image tags for reproducible builds
Cache dependencies with stable keys to speed jobs
Use manual gates for production deployments
anti_patterns: Using latest image tags in production pipelines
Skipping artifacts for build outputs needed downstream
Deploying to production without an approval gate

faq.question: Which GitLab versions are supported?
faq.answer: The patterns target standard GitLab CI features and should work on recent GitLab versions.

faq.question: Are there limits on pipeline size?
faq.answer: Limits depend on your GitLab plan and runner capacity, not on this skill.

faq.question: Can this integrate with existing runners?
faq.answer: Yes, examples assume standard GitLab runners and can be adapted to your runner setup.

faq.question: Is any sensitive data collected?
faq.answer: No, the content is static and does not access files, environment variables, or networks.

faq.question: What if a job fails after using this?
faq.answer: Check runner logs, image availability, and variable configuration, then adjust the example.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Actions?
faq.answer: It focuses on GitLab CI syntax and features instead of GitHub Actions workflows.
